What We Do ANDRITZ Metals, global leader in the metals processing and forming industry, provides comprehensive products and services for furnaces, rolling mills, strip processing lines, finishing lines, and welding across carbon, stainless, aluminum, and non-ferrous metals sectors. Name ARKU Inc What We Do About ARKU ARKU, founded in 1928 as a family owned company, is the world market leader in roller levelers and press feeding technology with more than 50 years of experience. ARKU offers the most extensive range of high-capacity and precision levelers, as well as deburring and edge rounding machines. This extensive portfolio is completed with the addition of parts handling solutions for leveling and deburring machines. With its headquarters in Baden-Baden, Germany, and ISO-certified facilities in Cincinnati (USA) and Kunshan (China), the company operates in nearly 30 countries worldwide. ARKU offers toll processing services in our three leveling and deburring center locations with state-of-the-art high performance machines. The product range comprises precision levelers, deburring and edge rounding machines for parts, automated parts handling via robots, in-line levelers, cut-to-length lines, press feeding lines and coil entry lines for roll formers. Name BARTON International What We Do Over the course of our 147 years of operation, family-owned Barton International has earned a reputation as the world’s leading producer of premium garnet abrasives. In the early 1980s, Barton played a key role in developing the first garnet abrasives for waterjet cutting. Still in production today, our American made ADIRONDACK® HPX® is the industry’s premier garnet for the most demanding applications. Our unwavering commitment to quality control and industry leading garnet processing standards gives our customers the confidence that Barton HPA® and HPX® waterjet abrasives will consistently perform as promised. With more than 40 stocking locations across North America, we can arrange prompt delivery to your shop. In addition to high performance garnet abrasives, Barton offers thousands of waterjet parts available to shop online at store.barton.com. We are proud to be an authorized distributor of genuine OEM parts from OMAX, Flow, H2O Jet, and KMT Waterjet. Name Bystronic What We Do Bystronic is an international leader in sheet metal processing technology and innovation. As a full solutions provider, the company offers advanced flat and tube laser cutting systems, press brakes, and intelligent automation solutions supported by global services. With Bystronic Software, the company is accelerating the digital transformation of the industry. Bystronic headquarters are located in Switzerland, with development and production facilities in Germany, Spain, Italy, China and the USA. The company serves customers in more than 30 countries with its own subsidiaries and a network of dealers and agents. The company’s Headquarters for the Americas is located in Hoffman Estates, IL. Completed in early 2020, the 165,000-sq.-ft. headquarters for the Bystronic Americas region includes a Customer Experience Center and Manufacturing Center. It locally serves as the hub for U.S. business operations including sales, service, training, spare parts, assembly of new Bystronic machines, and refurbishing of used Bystronic machinery. Name Chemical Coaters Association International What We Do The Chemical Coaters Association International (CCAI) is the finishing industry's FABTECH partner and is a technical and professional organization that provides information and training on industrial finishing technologies. CCAI works to raise the standards of finishing operations through its regional chapters, education and training programs, outreach with schools, colleges and universities, training manuals, and more. CCAI's training manuals are regularly updated with the most current information. Members have access to the latest trends in the finishing industry. Manuals include Pretreatment, System Design, Powder Coating, Liquid Coatings & Equipment, and Electrocoating. Most of the manuals are also available in Spanish. These training manuals serve as the basis for the CCAI Finishing Academy online courses. Led by instructors with extensive industrial finishing experience, the self-paced multi-week courses include weekly assignments, regular quizzes, and a final project. Available courses include Pretreatment, System Design, Powder Coating, and Liquid Coating. Women in Finishing (WiF), powered by CCAI, fosters personal and professional development for women who have chosen a career in finishing. WiF’s signature event is the WiF FORUM, an annual conference that features a variety of professional development and industry related sessions, a plant tour, team building, and networking. WiF is inclusive of all women in the industry from the paint line to executive management. The CCAI Finishing Education Foundation (CCAI FEF), a 501(c)(3) tax exempt charitable organization, was established to support education and training programs that improve skills at all levels within the industrial finishing and coatings industry. In collaboration with SparkForce, the FMA Foundation, CCAI FEF offers summer finishing camps for students aged 12-17. Students receive an overview of industrial finishing through hands-on experiments and projects, guest speakers, and a plant tour. Name Device Technologies Inc What We Do Device Technologies, Inc. (DTi), is a U.S. based engineering and manufacturing company specializing in high performance wire protection, sealing systems, and cable management solutions for over 40 years. You build the enclosure. DTi protection products help optimize it for your OEM clients. DTi does not cut or bend the metal. Once the enclosure is built, our products make sure it is protected, sealed and ready to support the products your OEMs want to build. DTi solutions reduce assembly time & costs & provide your OEM clients with instant component protection & improved system reliability. DTi Protection Products Include: Spring-Fast® Grommet Edging – prevents wire abrasion. No adhesive is needed reducing labor & improving safety. Simple finger pressure install saves at least 49% in total costs vs nylon glue in grommets & improves productivity by 9.5x - with no failures in +30 years. Seal-Fast™ Enclosure Seals & Trim- Fast™ Edging - add environmental sealing, & finishing to exposed edges, protecting the systems inside. Protect-Fast® Braided Sleeving & Wrap Tough, lightweight solutions efficiently protect wires, wire harnesses, bundles of cable or hoses from abrasion & cutting. UL94V-0 and FAR 25 compliant options available. Fast-Drop® Cable Waterfalls for fiber - protect against macro-bends ensuring data & power integrity. DTi is always looking for ways to help you improve your processes and end products. Come and see for yourself! Name Duroair Technologies USA Inc What We Do Duroair Technologies USA Inc. engineers flexible containment solutions that pair seamlessly with industrial air filtration systems to fit many industrial requirements. From coating processes, to dust collection and clean room applications, Duroair is dedicated to creating safer, compliant and efficient workspaces. Our DuroRoom modular enclosure retracts to 20% of its extended length, making it ideal for facilities where space is at a premium. Utilize your overhead crane to place your workpiece where needed and extend the DuroRoom around it with ease. Coating solutions include DuroPure, 6 stage recirculating filtration and DuroCap 2 stage vented filtration. The DuroCap captures 99.4% of particulate before discharging harmful VOCs and isocyantes to the exterior of the building. Our DuroDust is designed to meet OSHA standards for capturing silica dust at the source. Discover how Duroair can help you take control of your workspace with solutions built for performance and protection. Name ESCO Tool What We Do For over 70 years, ESCO Tool has worked closely with end-users, tackling the most challenging tube and pipe cutting and weld prep applications in pipeline construction, semiconductor, power generation, shipbuilding, oil & gas, aerospace, and other metalworking industries. Our knowledge and experience have allowed us to invent and manufacture high-quality tools that work efficiently with consistent, repeatable results. At this exhibition, we will showcase our robust O.D. clamping split frame machines, I.D. clamping, and pilot locating weld prep machines, all meticulously designed to prepare pipe and tube for welding with unwavering reliability. We will also feature our flange-facing system and air-powered saws for cutting tube and pipe, including boiler tube panels, tube alignment tools, and boiler tube expanding equipment. Name FACCIN GROUP USA What We Do The FACCIN GROUP is a leading manufacturer of metal rolling, bending, and forming machines. It will be showcasing innovations from its renowned brands — FACCIN, ROUNDO, and BOLDRINI — at booth #A-4331. The Group offers the widest selection of cutting-edge plate rolls, angle rolls, head forming lines, and special machines. We are able to craft solutions completely customized to your specifications, no matter their size or complexity. From construction through delivery, we thrive on pushing boundaries, innovating for larger sizes, thicker materials, and unique geometries. Our wide selection of high-quality solutions include: PLATE ROLLS 2-roll, 3-roll and 4-roll plate rolling machines from thin to heavier plate metal bending with thicknesses up to over 12 in (300 mm). ANGLE ROLLS 3 or 4-roll profile, tube & beam benders. Ideal to bend steel with a section modulus up to 7,900 in3 (20,000 cm3). HEAD FORMING LINES Automatic dishing presses with manipulators that can handle blank diameters up to 472 in (12000 mm), hydroforming presses that excels in forming plates up to 0.3 in (8 mm) thick and flanging machines that can handle cold forming up to 3 ¼ in (80 mm) while hot spinning can go up to 8 in (200 mm). SPECIAL MACHINES Onshore & offshore wind tower plate rolling systems, bending rolls for foundation manufacturing (tripods, jackets, floating, monopiles and TPs), heavy-duty bending rolls for pressure vessel, shipbuilding & aerospace and plate levelling machines. When start-to-finish traceability is a must, identification tags for fabricators and galvanizers from InfoSight get the job done. about: Name KAAST Machine Tools Inc What We Do KAAST Machine Tools is proud to provide one of the most diverse and extensive line-ups of machine tools in the industry. From mills and lathes to grinders and saws, and from brakes and rolls to presses and ironworkers, KAAST makes it easy to find the right machine for your application. Our commitment to customer satisfaction is unwavering, as we provide quick shipping of spare parts and an exceptional after-sales service. About Our Company Founded in Germany in 2009, KAAST established its U.S. headquarters in Philadelphia just a year later, in 2010. In 2023, we expanded further with the opening of our warehouse and showroom in Chicago. Since then, we’ve installed thousands of machines across the globe. We specialize in providing dependable, production-ready machines engineered for durability and low maintenance. With over 150 machines in stock across our Philadelphia and Chicago warehouses, we’re ready to ship fast and meet the demands of high-output operations. Name Lazer Safe Pty Ltd What We Do Lazer Safe specialises in developing and manufacturing control, safety and operator protection systems for press brakes and related sheet metal machinery. We design, develop, and manufacture a range of safety control systems, optical laser protection systems, and image processing systems specifically for hydraulic, hybrid, and electric press brakes, both for OEM and retrofit applications. Our primary path to market is through the press brake manufacturers, whom we collaborate with to embed systems and technology into press brake designs and achieve the highest possible level of functionality, safety, and performance. We also supply optical laser guarding systems for the press brake retrofit market. These systems improve the safety of existing machinery, protecting operators from injury while maintaining the highest possible level of machine functionality and performance. Our network of retrofit dealers and distributors provides retrofit sales, support, and installation services throughout the United States, Canada, and Mexico. We are also committed to the development of international safety standards and participate in several international standards committees, including CEN/TC, ANSI and ISO. We are actively involved in the education and promotion of standards and their correct application. Name Midwest Engineered Systems (MWES) What We Do Midwest Engineered Systems (MWES) is a premier systems integrator specializing in advanced robotic welding automation. Our systems are engineered to enhance weld quality, improve process consistency, and maximize production throughput. We design and build fully integrated welding cells using leading robotic platforms and welding technologies for MIG, TIG, ultrasonic, and resistance welding applications. From high-output production lines to collaborative solutions like the EasyArc™ cobot welding cart, our portfolio supports a wide range of manufacturing environments with rapid deployment and ease of use. Beyond welding, MWES provides turnkey industrial automation solutions for assembly, material handling, machine tending, web handling and converting. All systems are engineered, fabricated, and supported in-house by our multidisciplinary team of mechanical, electrical, and software experts. Name Modula What We Do Modula is a leading manufacturer of automated storage solutions designed to optimize space and improve picking and storage operations for any industrial sector or environment. Our vertical lift module (VLM) line maximizes the storage potential of high-ceiling facilities, securing items in enclosed units up to 54 feet tall. Our horizontal carousels are ideal for low-ceiling environments as well as those seeking maximum throughput. Established in 2003, MSS Group has built a strong reputation and has unrivalled experience of supplying laser cutting gas system solutions and today has over 1200 lasers working with MSS nitrogen gas globally. Our product range includes the super efficient and compact NitroCube high pressure on site nitrogen generation system, specifically designed for laser cutting applications. We are also very proud of the NitrO2 laser gas mixing unit that can optimise the cutting efficiency and quality of any type of fiber laser cutting machine. This unit allows the operator to vary the nitrogen/oxygen mix of the assist gas begin used in real time. Name Muratec USA What We Do Murata Machinery USA, Inc. (Muratec USA) is a subsidiary of Murata Machinery Ltd., a family-owned company founded in 1935 in Kyoto, Japan. A global leader in industrial automation, Muratec USA has a rich history of innovation and leadership in North America. Built on a tradition of innovation and reliability, the Muratec Fabrication business unit excels in delivering advanced turret punch presses, multifunction punch/laser machines, and automation systems. This expertise stems from the company’s acquisition of the Wiedemann line in 1989—a brand that introduced the first punch press in 1934. Muratec USA’s fabrication solutions provide sheet metal manufacturers with the flexibility to rapidly integrate processes that improve productivity. The merger of Wiedemann’s strong mechanical engineering with Muratec’s advanced automation created an enduring legacy of fabrication innovation. This powerful combination not only enhanced punch press technology but also advanced manufacturing solutions that offer greater flexibility, precision, and speed. For 90 years, Muratec has driven innovation in automation, delivering breakthrough technologies that have empowered customers worldwide to boost efficiency and stay competitive across a wide range of industries. For over half a century, Muratec USA has proudly carried that legacy forward, advancing our parent company’s vision throughout North America. Name Nova Sidera Metal Forming Corp What We Do Nova Sidera is an engineering boutique focused, since 1990, on designing and manufacturing spinning lathes and special machines for the deformation of metal sheet. From the heart of Monferrato, Italy, we have developed a passion for metal working, combining high technology with a strong vocation for craftsmanship. about: Name PPG What We Do PPG is one of the world’s leading providers of comprehensive industrial coating solutions in every major technology platform. PPG stands apart with high performance solutions at every layer. This expertise means that our products are compatible and optimized for peak performance, corrosion resistance and asset longevity. A pioneer in powder coating innovations, PPG recently launched PPG ENVIROLUXE™ Plus powder which include up to 18% post-industrial recycled plastic (rPET) and are specifically made without PFAS substances. The coatings achieve up to a 30% reduction in carbon footprint compared to standard durable powders and are engineered to protect a wide range of products, including fencing, shelving and racks. PPG’s primer portfolio includes PPG PRIMERON™ OPTIMAL zinc epoxy powder primer. This cutting-edge innovation meets ISO C5 corrosivity specifications but is less dense and easier to apply than standard zinc-rich primers. Other PPG solutions include PPG VERSABOND™ zinc-phosphate pretreatment, PPG POWERCRON® 10X™ electrocoat, PPG SPECTACRON® liquid coatings and PPG ENVIROCRON® HTE powder with a first pass transfer rate of up to 85%. Our expertise includes protective coating application services and equipment design, as well as specialized solutions for light industrial manufacturers. Name Quantum Machinery Group What We Do Quantum Machinery Group is one of the largest and most trusted metalworking machinery distributors in the United States, offering one of the most diverse and complete lines of metal fabrication equipment available. As the exclusive U.S. importer and distributor of Siegmund Welding Tables, MACC Saws, and Nargesa Metalworking Machines, we provide premium solutions for nearly every stage of the fabrication process—from cutting and bending, to forging, forming, and welding. We proudly stock and support the full range of Siegmund Welding Tables, including System 16, 22, and 28 tables, fixturing kits, positioning systems, rail systems, and mobile workbenches—engineered with precision and built to perform in the most demanding environments. Our MACC line features high-performance manual, semi-automatic, and fully automatic cold saws and band saws built in Italy. These machines are designed for accuracy, durability, and speed when cutting tube, pipe, solid bar, and structural material. From Nargesa, we offer a robust line of industrial machines including ironworkers, hydraulic press brakes, section bending machines, tube and pipe benders, hot forging presses, power hammers, bar twisting machines, and more. Each machine is built for strength, efficiency, and versatility—ideal for structural, ornamental, and custom fabrication. With a massive in-stock inventory, full in-house technical support team, and the fastest shipping in the industry, Quantum delivers not just machines—but complete, reliable solutions for fabrication shops of every size. From first cut to final weld, Quantum Machinery Group is your partner in premium metalworking solutions. Name Sames What We Do For nearly 100 years, Sames has been a global leader in providing advanced equipment and solutions for the application of liquid and powder paints, adhesives, and sealants—designed to bond, protect, and beautify all types of surfaces. Since 1960, we’ve specialized in powder coating technologies, delivering solutions that meet the most demanding productivity and performance standards. Our powder coating product line is branded under Sames Inocoat. Sames North America is proud to announce the grand opening of our state-of-the-art Powder Lab in Plymouth, Michigan. This advanced facility reflects our commitment to continuous innovation, offering a hands-on environment to test and demonstrate our latest manual and automatic powder coating technologies. Key Highlights of the Sames Powder Lab: *Rapid Color Change with Inobooth – Discover fast, clean, and efficient color changes for high-mix production environments. *Precision Automation with Inogun A and InoBell – Improve efficiency and consistency using our next-generation automatic applicators. *Inocoat Manual Applicators with TEC5 Technology – Maximize transfer efficiency and coating quality with our advanced TEC5-equipped manual guns. Name Solar Atmospheres What We Do Solar Atmospheres is a global leader in commercial vacuum heat treating and brazing services. Name T. J. Snow Company What We Do T. J. Snow Company is a recognized industry leader in resistance welding machinery, service, and training. Founded in 1963 and headquartered in Chattanooga, Tennessee, we’ve built a legacy of innovation, quality, and customer focus for over six decades. Our company is dedicated to helping manufacturers across a wide range of industries optimize their welding processes with reliable, high-performance resistance welding solutions. As a full-service resistance welding provider, we manufacture our own line of resistance welders right here in the USA, designed for durability, precision, and long-term productivity. In addition to new equipment, we offer a wide range of used and refurbished machines, custom-designed weld cells, and an extensive inventory of welding consumables and supplies. Name TITAN-Catalytic and NIKO Conveyors What We Do TITAN-Catalytic is a leading provider of gas infrared catalytic heaters, ovens, and multi-OEM heater repairs & refurbishments. Our Ovens are expertly designed to save space, reduce energy costs, and exceed industry standards. One of the key highlights of TITAN-Catalytic's infrared technology is its application in IR curing ovens. Unlike traditional convection ovens, our infrared ovens enable rapid heat transfer through IR energy waves directly to the coating or part. This efficient process significantly reduces curing time and enhances overall productivity. By directly heating the coated part surface, TITAN's ovens eliminate the need to heat the entire substrate or the surrounding air, resulting in substantial energy savings and improved process efficiency. When you choose TITAN-Catalytic, you can rest assured that you're getting the best in heating and oven technology! Name TubeWorks Software What We Do Smarter Bending Starts Here TubeWorks is powerful, user-friendly software that takes the complexity out of tube and pipe manufacturing. Designed for seamless integration with SOLIDWORKS, it automates bend data extraction, cut lengths, centerline geometry, and machine-ready output — all within seconds. At ITEC, we fully integrate TubeWorks into every machine we deliver. That means no extra setup, no time lost, and no disconnect between engineering and the shop floor. address: This new AI-driven process eliminates complex and expensive custom solutions that require programming — simplifying adoption of this in-demand automation solution. Vention is slated to commercialize its AI-driven bin-picking technology later this year. Automation leader Vention today unveiled a physical AI breakthrough with AI-powered bin picking that enables robots to detect, select, pick up, and organize parts from a bin of unstructured data - reducing integration and programming costs. During a live demonstration, an ABB GoFa™ CRB 15000 robot — equipped with vision, finger grippers, and connected to a Vention MachineMotion AI controller — will demonstrate its autonomous capabilities. Using only an uploaded CAD file of the part being processed, the robot understands how to detect, select, pick and organize the part with industry-leading speed and precision. This level of autonomy is possible through the powerful foundation models.

about: Name Verisurf Software Inc What We Do Verisurf is a 3D measurement solutions company with 35 years of technology leadership in advanced computer-aided inspection, CMM programming, reverse engineering, tool-building, and metrology education solutions. Verisurf interfaces with the latest as well as legacy 3D measurement systems, including CMMs, portable CMM arms, laser trackers, and 3D scanners from API, Creaform, FARO, Hexagon, Kreon, Leica, LK, Mitutoyo, Renishaw, Romer, Scantech, Wenzel, Zeiss, and many more. Verisurf software is compatible with all major CAD formats for modern, computer-aided inspection. Verisurf automates and streamlines AS9100 ballooned drawing inspection for first article inspection reporting (FAIR). Verisurf reverse engineering software includes advanced tools essential for fabricated, machined, molded, formed, 3D printed and other additive manufacturing technologies. Capabilities include STL mesh editing, cleanup, decimation, optimization, NURBS surfacing, wireframe sketching, and solid modeling. Name VITRONIC Machine Vision What We Do VITRONIC is the world's leading innovation driver for industrial image processing. VITRONIC develops forward-looking solutions of specialized products and software for image-based quality inspection, identification, and process optimization. VITRONIC solutions help shape a safe and sustainable world. VITRONIC's automated visual inspection systems and software are used to ensure quality welds in the manufacturing of production parts. That's why since 1995, leading OEMs and tier-1 suppliers worldwide have been using our inspection systems in the production of safety critical parts. Through the aggregation of collected data, our visual inspection solutions allow you to maximize the performance of your welding process. As a reliable partner, we’re always ready to assist customers in incorporating our systems into their production lines and supporting future markets, like electromobility. Collaboration with our customers allow them to fully exploit technological capabilities and process efficiencies. Joint success forms the basis of long-term relationships with companies like BMW, Daimler, Kuka, Fronius, Fanuc, and Lincoln Electric. Since its foundation in 1984, VITRONIC has consistently grown to over $305 million, with operations on five continents and over 80 countries with over 1,400 employees. Name Wilson Tool International What We Do What can help you to be the best fabricator in the industry? A tooling partner who understands that a tool is more than just a tool… it’s a solution. A solution to reduce downtime. A solution for increasing efficiency. A solution for complex applications. A solution for gaining a competitive edge. Punching Solutions • Busbar Tooling: our busbar tooling delivers precise, consistent results in copper, aluminum, and steel. • Shimless Die Adapter: measure, adjust, and insert your die for fast setups and minimal downtime. • QuickTap® Tapping Tools: tap up to 200 threaded holes per minute, eliminating time-consuming secondary operations. • Multi-Tools: Maximize your punch press capacity (from 3 to 30 tools) and drastically reduce tool changeovers, keeping your machines running longer and more efficiently. • Benefit from HPX® Guide Assemblies® for easy setup and EXP® Punch Tip Tooling for double the life of traditional punches. Bending Solutions • eClamp™ Electric Press Brake Clamp: Experience the world's first electric press brake clamp. Its modular design, intuitive LED lights, and one-touch clamping simplify operation and enhances safety. • Press Brake Specials: Have a complex bend? Our "never say no" attitude means we turn your most unique and challenging applications into reality. • V-Series Black (VSB) Dies: Simplify complex bends! These dies make it easier to produce small flanges, small bend radii, and bends closer to holes.
